newsitem.title: TURKEY: TURK TEXTILE FIRM BOYASAN TO FLOAT PART CAPITAL.
newsitem.headline: TURK TEXTILE FIRM BOYASAN TO FLOAT PART CAPITAL.

text.p: Turkish textile firm Boyasan Tekstil Sanayi ve Ticaret A.S. will float shares representing a part of its capital in a two-day offer beginning on May 22, consortium leader Inter Yatirim said in a written statement.
It said the fixed offer price would be 11,000 lira for each 1,000 lira nominal valued share.
Boyasan will offer 50 billion lira of new shares and 37.5 billion lira of old shares to public while raising its capital to 250 billion lira from 200 billion.
Of the total 87.5 million shares on offer, 50 percent will be allocated to foreign investors and 10 percent to domestic instutional investors, Inter Yatirim said.
Boyasan, owned by Turkey's leading textile exporter Uslu Holding is active in dyeing and stamping of fabrics.
The company aims to use income from the public offer to pay down its financial debts and thus raise profitability.
It expects 1997 profit before tax to rise also because major investments are to be completed by the end of May.
